DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number that represents the calculated variation of the z-score (sensitive to outliers), which substitutes the outlier-insensitive median and median absolute deviation (MAD) for mean and standard deviation in the z-score calculation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A process of progressive and tight packing of dispersed replicated interphase chromatin into compact structures in metaphase prior to mitotic or meiotic nuclear division or during apoptosis in eukaryotic cells._A variation of the z-score, which substitutes the outlier-insensitive median and median absolute deviation (MAD) for mean and standard deviation in the z-score calculation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A process of progressive and tight packing of dispersed replicated interphase chromatin into compact structures in metaphase prior to mitotic or meiotic nuclear division or during apoptosis in eukaryotic cells.

Concepts.definition: A process of progressive and tight packing of dispersed replicated interphase chromatin into compact structures in metaphase prior to mitotic or meiotic nuclear division or during apoptosis in eukaryotic cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: A variation of the z-score, which substitutes the outlier-insensitive median and median absolute deviation (MAD) for mean and standard deviation in the z-score calculation.

Concepts.definition: A variation of the z-score, which substitutes the outlier-insensitive median and median absolute deviation (MAD) for mean and standard deviation in the z-score calculation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support CTD2 activity per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/28/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A computed numerical quantity that represents the score indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of standard deviation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CTD^2 project per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/29/15
